_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:

? California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

? Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

? California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

? Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as

necessary. To accomplish this, Giumarra Vineyards Winery has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with

updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities.



1.1 GIUMARRA VINEYARDS WINERY, RISK & PROCESS SAFETY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Giumarra Vineyards Winery has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to

address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities:



Process Name Process Chemical Process Quantity(lbs.)



P11 - Aqueous Ammonia System Aqueous Ammonia 29.4% Aq. NH3 Solution 38,000

P13 - Sulfur Dioxide Injection Storage Sulfur Dioxide 26,000



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of

hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, and illnesses and avoid physical property damage.



Giumarra Vineyards Winery has an exemplary safety record, one that we are quite proud of. Our company has many p

olicies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public

safety. We have:

1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM plan to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well

2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general Giumarra Vineyards Winery business practices

3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary Giumarra Vineyards Winery employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees protect themselves and our neighbors.



1.2 PROCESS DESCRIPTIONS



The Giumarra Vineyards, Winery facility is a processing facility for grape juice concentrate products. The facility has two ammonia processes that provide refrigeration capacity to multiple product

chillers, an aqueous ammonia storage tank which is part of a carbon filter regeneration process, and a sulfur-dioxide injection process for grape juice.



1.3 GENERAL ACCIDENT RELEASE & CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



1.3.1 GENERAL



We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss

preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.



Giumarra Vineyards Winery has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the

purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in the body of the program.



1.3.3 SULFUR-DIOXIDE



The sulfur-dioxide injection process at the Giumarra Vineyards, Winery facility is an integral part of the juicing process for grapes. Injection of the grapes takes place during the initial crush which

operates four months out of the year. The process involves two (2) ton containers with a maximum intended inventory

of 4,000 lbs. Two injection points are operated with one container connected

at each point. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Giumarra Vineyards is committed to making sure that employees are made

aware of the potential danger of exposure to sulfur-dioxide.



Our refrigeration personnel also monitor the sulfur-dioxide injection process and keep an active log of all associated procedures and transactions. In addition, the process is checked frequently

during the season by the outside contractor that supplies the SO2 containers. Snowden also assists in performing the annual mechanical integrity review of our system/process equipment.



1.3.4 AQUEOUS AMMONIA

The aqueous ammonia process at the Giumarra Vineyards, Winery facility is an integral part of the grape juice concentrate manufacturing process and operates year round. The ammonia

concentration in the solution is 29.4% and the Storage Tank has a 5,000 gal capacity. As with the ammonia systems management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of

the potential danger of an aqueous ammonia leak.



Giumarra Vineyards personnel monitor the aqueous ammonia process and storage tank. In addition, the tank is checked by the vendor supplying the aqueous ammonia. The vender also assists

in performing the annual mechanical integrity review of our aqueous ammonia equipment.



1.4 FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



Giumarra Vineyards Winery has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.



1.5 EMERGENCY ACTION AND RESPONSE PLAN



Giumarra Vineyards Winery's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:



? California "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR ?3220

? Federal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38

? California "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 8 CCR Title 8 ?5192(q)

? Federal "Hazardous Waste Operations and Em

ergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 29 CFR ?1910.120(q)



Strategically, we will respond "minimally" to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the

Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team.



Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.



1.6 PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Our company has an outstanding safety record, one that we are quite proud of. Many policies and procedures have been implemented to promote overall plant, worker and public safety.

Nevertheless, Giumarra Vineyards Winery continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.



By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Giumarra Vineyards Winery's ability to communicate

hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Giumarra Vineyards Winery's management team can ensure that the RMP-

PSM program is being implemented.



Giumarra Vineyards Winery has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard

analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been

completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.



In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Giumarra Vineyards Winery has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with

RMP-PSM program implementation. A copy of Resource Compliance

's service agreement has been included in this program with the support material.



For the future, Giumarra Vineyards Winery now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Giumarra Vineyards Winery

employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Giumarra Vineyards Winery will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
